website_summaries.verdict: A great option for anyone with a high-end 4K display and a large library of physical media to enjoy.
pros: Optimized for HDR playback in full 4K
Works with TVs featuring lower resolutions

website_summaries.verdict: The LG UP870 4K Blu-ray player strips down its feature set to the bare minimum and concentrates on what's important: superlative performance
pros: The LG UP870 4K Blu-ray player, for the same price as many HD-only models, is excellent value for money
It offers the best disc-loading speeds of any player to date and is capable of excellent image quality
cons: The player lacks the features you might expect for a 4K player including Dolby Vision, Wi-Fi and streaming apps
The remote control isn't all that fun to use

customer_reviews.title: No movie apps, no add on products, a quality Blu-ray player with great performance, operation & feel.
customer_reviews.text: Worked my way through a Samsung & couple of Sony Blu-ray players hopefully & so far so good, I will keep this LG. No Netflix, Prime, Roku et al functions. Plays movies very well with excellent clarity picture & audio. Appears to be a quality Blu-ray player that excels at one thing. Fast load, very good fast forward & pause operations, no issues playing Blu-rays. (that's all I use it for). FYI I have a Samsung 4K smart TV, the Samsung Blu-ray conflicted with the smart TV kept waking up & changing ports, generally causing trouble. Bought 2 models of Sony Blu-rays both were not very good. Happy with my LG.
customer_reviews.author: ukcolin

customer_reviews.title: Super quick/easy set up and crystal clear image!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! I have a 70" Samsung LED, 3D capable TV and this is the PERFECT player with it. Hookup/setup took all of about 10 minutes from when I opened the box until I was playing the first 4K movie. And it plays great! Couldn't be happier with it!
customer_reviews.author: Randy M

customer_reviews.title: After 4 months, dvd tray won't open or close
customer_reviews.text: The tray that opens and closes to hold the dvd won't open, and if I can get it to open, it won't close again. If it does close again, it'll say that there is no dvd in the tray, even though there IS a dvd in the tray. Picture is great, easy to use, too bad it was only designed to last for a couple of months. Support window closed 2 weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Nice little player
customer_reviews.text: Okay, LG, you made a pretty decent simple 4k Blu Ray player that isn't overloaded with price, or bells and whistles
customer_reviews.author: Dpoll

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a basic high-qaulity DVD/Blu-ray/UHD player
customer_reviews.text: It is a very new and high quality DVD/Blu-ray/UHD disc player. It loads movies fast and the menu is simple. It doesn't have many bells and whistles--which I don't need, especially because I have an Apple TV. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Drew

customer_reviews.title: it does allow my smart tv controller to control the player so use of ...
customer_reviews.text: for starters this is not a "smart" player. you can connect it the internet but only to do updates for the player. you can not play apps such as netflix, hulu, or hbo. it does allow my smart tv controller to control the player so use of multiple remotes are not needed. have had for a few months with no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky I.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic surprise
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this DVD player as it advertised that it would play video from a USB2 Flashdrive. The video file formats that were advertised were(are) .avi, .mpg, .mpeg. To my joy, I discovered that it also support the .vob file type and that these files played as though it was a 4k image. No pixelation as I got from a computer generated DVD.
customer_reviews.author: Passion4Diving

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't support LG TV Deep Color feature and won't play disc,
customer_reviews.text: Does not play 4K Blu-Ray disc as it's not compatible with the LG "Deep Color" feature. This feature is meant to enhance the picture quality and play it at its optimal setting but when the TV turns the feature on, the disc stops playing. Thought this was strange as they are both LG units. My TV is an LG UHD 4K TV and I don't understand why there's an issue. I can turn the feature off, but when I start playing the disc again, the feature turns back on and Im stuck in a loop.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Value for Money  3D UHD Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a low price UHD player for my LG OLED 4K 3D TV and this player is just perfect. It plays 3D blu-ray, UHD i.e 4K and regular blu-ray disc. I tried my DVD and they also look amazing. Player lacks smart features but that was not my requirement in the first place. Please note that player doesnt have any ports other than HDMI and Optical out and only wired network is supported. While it was not a concern for me but if can be problem for many other buyers. Overall, I am extremely happy with this player.
customer_reviews.author: Ravindra Deoray

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed with picture quality
customer_reviews.text: No frills 4K HDR Blu-ray player. I already have multiple streaming devices, so just wanted a basic player to play 4K discs. Not disappointed with picture quality. Better than streaming quality. Discs load up quicker than my other non-4K Blu-ray players. Remote is a bit small.
customer_reviews.author: B. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Great for 15 minute intervals
customer_reviews.text: Movie turns off every 15 minutes. The power on the unit is on, but the TV screen switches to screen saver. Tried correcting in the menus and it still doesn’t work. The TV is not set to timeout due to inactivity and neither is the blu-ray player. I do not recommend this unit bc it’s extremely frustrating to turn the movie back on every 15 minutes. Tried hooking the unit up to multiple HDMI ports and other devices work fine. This player is nice - in 15 minute intervals. This unit is hooked up to an LG OLED 4K TV and it’s firmware was updated - another annoyance bc it has to be hard wired for updates.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Mantooth 26

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Thank God the unit that was sent to me was not defective! Thank God for HDMI I was able to connect the player to my LG television without a hitch. Then I just had to figure out how to switch from TV to DVD display by pressing the input button on the TV Remote Control. This worked very well for me because my TV and DVD player are both from LG.
customer_reviews.author: NR

customer_reviews.title: Nice DVD player
customer_reviews.text: We have a home in a remote location where streaming movies is not a good option, so DVDs it is. This player works really well for us, and it is very compact. It has played a number of even public library DVDs without skipping, which is quite a testimony to its quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mojave Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great great buy all around!!
customer_reviews.text: Comes with two cords-one for smart tv and for older tv models with aux cables. Was super easy and fast to connect to my smart tv and add to my TVs recognized devices. Very good picture quality, even on older discs. I bought American/Canadian model as those are the only type of dvds I own. And it takes up barely any space!
customer_reviews.author: midwestfamily

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: Just one Outstanding Blu-Ray player. It was delivered on time without any damage and it was the fastest set up I have ever done. Out of the box and watching a movie within 15 Min. I call them as I see them, and this is one fine Blu-Ray player at a great price for a basic unit without all the extra stuff, Wi-Fi, Apps....(Less stuff to break) I recommend this to one and all that want a great Blu-Ray player at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last March..it has been fine until a few days ago, It started to play a DVD - stopped - and said "Invalid Format"... It never resolved this problem. Just got a new Sony DVD - so disappointed! I have an LG OLED 65" TV that is great! Should have believed the poor ratings on this one! Bummer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Straight Out Of Box Won’t Read ANY DVD- Junk Machine
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple months ago for our trailer. Just barely opened it a few days ago, tried to play a movie, it just kept spitting it out. We tried every version of DVD, it rejected absolutely all of them. Total junk...I should have paid better attention to the almost 15% negative reviews. Don’t throw your money say on this! Because the seller only has a 30 day return policy, mine is going to the landfill this week! I can’t even donate it! Bye bye all that money I just flushed down the toilet. This was my first LG anything...and my last! Also won’t buy from this seller again. I’ll go to my local big-box store for better customer care.
customer_reviews.author: PoleGirl2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me..easiest set up ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player BECAUSE it did not have internet based apps. Ever since I bought my 4K tv I have had connection issues due to the tv and my previous DVD player having internet based apps on them. With this player, all the issues disappeared. Not only that, but the picture quality is much better than my previous blu ray. One suggestion for those interested......if you have a 2160 tv, make sure you invest another $15 for a 4K HDMI cable. Update....unfortunately, the connection issues have returned...I will have a service rep check everything out..however, it could not possibly be the fault of the DVD player..
customer_reviews.author: TOPvol

customer_reviews.title: Player works flawless on 4K, 1080p discs and flash drive file.
customer_reviews.text: works and looks perfect, firmware upgrade when on no proble. Easy to use menus. Any Blu ray disc or flash drive video I had thrown at it worked no problem, even burned blu rays. No matter if MP4, MKV, MT2, M2TS, MTS, AVI. No its not as good as my Oppo, but its 1/5 the price also. For a Sub $100 4k Blu Ray player you just cant go wrong, make sure to get the 2.0b UHD HDR cable if you want the full potential out of your 4k Ultra UHD HDR10 HDTV . Works great on the Hinense 65in 4k UHD HDR $499 tv from sams club and my 60in 3D LG TV.
customer_reviews.author: THXkid

customer_reviews.title: It works..
customer_reviews.text: The HDMI cable it literally so short you can't use it. If you plan to use the USB port to play movies stored on an external hard drive you can forget about it. It doesn't recognize the content.... it is really the only reason I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: rodney hurst

customer_reviews.title: Great player without the bloatware.
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace my Samsung 4k player after it died. I wanted a simple machine without all the apps I would never use. This fit the bill, and the price was great too. I've played about half a dozen discs, all have played flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Keith K.

customer_reviews.title: BUGGY, but it does play UHD discs (so far)
customer_reviews.text: Upon plugging in the unit, it started flashing the setup screen off and on apparently endlessly. I was able to navigate it enough to find a "Play" button, and the UHD disc I inserted started up and played fine. Unfortunately the sound is a bit out of sync, and it is beyond me to try to find how to correct this in the flashing screens. Looks like it will need to be returned, though I'm not sure how to do this with the current coronavirus lockdown. Cannot recommend this unit based on the performance issues I have encountered.
customer_reviews.author: Gryphon

customer_reviews.title: Nice DVD
customer_reviews.text: Seems like not many name brand DVDs are available anymore. This one from LG was a logical choice. It works great and takes up a small footprint. I'm using mine with a Yamaha 7.2 receiver / amp, Infinity speakers, and a Visio LED monitor. Has a great picture and sound. In fact, I'm buying another one for the bedroom TV.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W

customer_reviews.title: Slim and easy
customer_reviews.text: It's light and easy to put away in tight spaces. Picture quality is smooth for recently made movies while a bit jarring on the eyes for older titles(The bigger the resolution the rougher the quality. Remote feels smooth and comfortable in the hands and pressing buttons causes no strain on the hands and joints. I'm an english user so I didn't have to make adjustments when it came to languages.(English is default) All in all, great dvd player.
customer_reviews.author: Jena R

customer_reviews.title: Skip and get a better quality player!!
customer_reviews.text: Price can't be beat! However my particular player skips frequently. By frequently I mean the screen will go black for a second and the audio will stop for a moment. I read up on 4k Blu-ray players and found out this is an issue with many players. If it only happened once and awhile I would be fine with it, however it happens once every 2 minutes or even less!! Ruins the movie watching experience. So far I have tried regular dvd's, blu-rays, and 4k blu-rays. It has skipped with every single one. I kept the player passed the return date hoping a software update would fix the issue. So far I've had one update and no change. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Shane S

customer_reviews.title: Not up to snuff
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a less expensive to the Sony HDR 4k dvd player. That was a mistake. The LG had trouble reading discs, frequently skipped, and indeed couldn't even reliably play a regular Blu-ray disc reliably. As opposed to my old Sony Blu-ray player more than 6 years old. So I finally decided to exchange it for the Sony model - even if it does cost a few dollars more. I'm glad I did. The picture is better. It has dual HDMI output for video and sound and, of course, wireless capability. I would pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Herrington

customer_reviews.title: Well recommended 4K UHD Blu-Ray & DVD Player
customer_reviews.text: CNET recommended this model as their best choice near the end of 2018. The player was easy to set up and works like a charm. I and my family are happy with it. Please do remember that you should us a HDMI 2.0 cable with this to pass the 4k and UHD to your TV in the best possible speed and condition.
customer_reviews.author: MstrAlex

customer_reviews.title: Works great when it decides to work
customer_reviews.text: The unit seems to have difficulty in deciding when its actually turned on or not. The little green light will come on but the unit won't respond in any way. Turning it on and off doesn't work so the only remedy I have found is to unplug the unit then plug it back in, After that it will behave fine for a while then the whole cycle starts over. It also seems to happen more often when a disk has been left in the unit when it was powered off.
customer_reviews.author: K. J. Kendall

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: If you want a budget 4k player with minimal features, this is it. In addition to the very limited features, the one I received has intermittent display problems. A typical movie will lose the picture once every 10-15 minutes. I know it's the player because the movie picks up exactly where it was interrupted. Otherwise, the picture and sound are what I expect from a 4k player.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Freezes up - don't bother with this
customer_reviews.text: This thing will sort of skip more than once in a while and then it will totally freeze up. The only thing you can do is unplug it to get it to reset. It does this on any disc you put in. There is also white static in the video. Sending it back. Don't bother buying this piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Jason B

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple 4k player
customer_reviews.text: Great 4K player. Picture was awesome. This is a basic player without the smart apps that other players have, so don't buy it expecting to have WIFI capabilities or the ability to stream Netflix. It doesn't do that. But, it does play 4k and blu-ray disks very well.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Display settings don't stick, remote is very finicky and must be pointed directly at the player to function.
customer_reviews.text: Defauts to an SD display for its menu and disc playback. While this can be changed to 2160p using the sUP870's setup menu there is no way to save this setting so when I power it back on I have to change it again. I have this connected to a Vizio 70 inch e70-e3 4K HDR. Another complaint I have is the remote has to be pointed in a very direct line of sight with the player for it to work unlike other remotes I have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price almost doubled
customer_reviews.text: I bought one last year before Christmas, for $116 from Amazon. The current amazon price is $229? They are great, but I won't buy one for $100s more then a year ago. This is not a good deal at $229. You can get a player with more features for about a $170.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Carvey

customer_reviews.title: Worst remote and menu features
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about the picture itself but I am having a lot of issues getting to the disc menus. Also the "caption" button does not start subtitle so if you want them you need to be in the menu. Which as I mentioned is not easy to get to. I am not sure if this is a bug with my player alone or as designed.
customer_reviews.author: Callygirl

customer_reviews.title: Tray kept opening. Wouldn't read disc.
customer_reviews.text: Kudos to those that were able to make this player work. I read really great reviews for this product, but I didn't get that experience at all. The player would not read multiple discs and would eject the disc almost immediately. After giving up because I wasn't going to get this player to work, I had the same experience when I tried to turn the player off as it would shut off, but the tray would eject after it turned off. Also, this player is not aesthetically pleasing to look at in its design.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Fortune

customer_reviews.title: HDMI cable sent was no good
customer_reviews.text: I wasted 10 minutes trying to troubleshoot, brand new out of the box, because the HDMI cable they sent was no good. I switched to an old HDMI cable that I had saved, and the player worked just fine. I ought to get something back for having to use my own cable. You should let people know the cables are no good, so they don't return the unit because it won't function. Not everybody would think to switch out the cables. It was advertised as coming with a new cable, which it did, and right out of the package the cable was bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow factor is well, a big WOW
customer_reviews.text: Well, I'll have to say, I'm impressed. The first dvd I played just to see if the unit works after ser up was a re write that I've played many times on my 10 year old blue ray. The clarity was stunning. Especially compared to the old unit.I like the simplicity no un needed perks that my tv has anyway. Just an awesome pic and sound and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Orin

customer_reviews.title: Don't have to convert my library, again.
customer_reviews.text: Terrific product. Documentation is a little thin, but could figure out what I wanted without too much trouble. Upconverting DVDs (and even Blu Rays) results in superior video and audio. Of course, part of that is the quality of the DVDs and Blu Rays to begin with, but even movies using the USB port are great. And I can genuinely see the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Mitoch

customer_reviews.title: Good Blu Ray player handicapped by a quirky remote contol
customer_reviews.text: This Blu-Ray player spins up a disc and is ready to operate quicker than any other device I’ve seen. The picture is great but the remote control is seriously flawed. It takes two presses of the same a button to enter a command. For example, to fast forward, you press the button once to wake up the remote, and then press the same button again to fast forward. That’s a serious design flaw in an otherwise good player.
customer_reviews.author: Call_Them_As_I_See_Them

customer_reviews.title: I don't need the Smart features, that's Roku's job
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I'm looking for. I don't need the Smart features, that's Roku's job. I was surprised that it plays my "Strike back" UK version Region 2 disc with no problem. It didn't play on my other Sony Bluray. I only wish it had on the fly subtitles and audio buttons. You have to go to options to enable those features. Other than that, I'm pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good player.
customer_reviews.text: Good player. Great for UHD, but lower format videos (blue ray, DVD) are upscaled nicely. Easy to set up and operate.
customer_reviews.author: EWB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent video player. And nothing else.
customer_reviews.text: It is getting increasingly difficult to find a bluray player that did just that, play bluray disks. That is all this device does, and does it very well. No apps, no weather, doesn't make toast, won't make your hair shinier. Just plays bluray & DVD disks
customer_reviews.author: Suvendra Nath Dutta

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my time. Total fail.
customer_reviews.text: As other reports indicate, this player stops after an hour or less. It actually sends a reset to my Samsung TV! My best guess is it’s overheating but even with ventilation and a fan it starts resetting. Arrived on a Saturday, I will be returning it Monday! DON’T BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I do have to say we own quit ...
customer_reviews.text: Came earlier than promised, plays much sharper than our older Blue Ray. So far so good. I do have to say we own quit a few LG products are have great luck with all.
customer_reviews.author: LGonden

customer_reviews.title: Does not do what it advertises which is the only reason I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Does not play any video files from a thumb drive except AVI. Does not even recognize any files on a hard drive via USB. The ONLY reason I got this was to play video files it says it will play. Going back and the search continues.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: 4K UHD resolution 3840×2160 why pay for junk options
customer_reviews.text: Simple, NO apps, but then I did not want apps just a good 4K player and this delivered. My DVR, TV, and Receiver all have built in apps. So why pay for apps when you have tons of other options. Great player and video quality!
customer_reviews.author: Censored

customer_reviews.title: NO WIFI
customer_reviews.text: IT DOESN’T HAVE WIFI. So it’s useless to me. I didn’t notice that the description mentions this. Didn’t think any players came without WiFi now. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: cd listener

customer_reviews.title: False starts
customer_reviews.text: Every time it is used-- at least 50 by now, it has completely died anywhere from about 5 to 15 minutes into the DVD. It does restart itself and pick up where it left off, but it is very unsettling, especially if you are watching a scary movie. I wouldn't buy it again. I'll probably get a good quality brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: SongBird

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little product. The closed captioning did not work when the DVD player was connected through the HDMI cable that was included. The closed captioning did work when the DVD player was connected through the red, yellow, and white AV cables that also came included.
customer_reviews.author: Sara P

customer_reviews.title: great little dvd player
customer_reviews.text: I PURCHASED THIS PLAYER BECAUSE MY OLD ONE WOULD NOT WORK WITH MY NEW PROJECTOR SO I NEEDED A NEW ONE. I PLUGGED IT IN RIGHT OUT OF THE BOX WHEN IT ARRIVED AND LO AND BEHOLD, MOVIES, ALL KINDS OF MOVIES PROJECTED UP ON A SCREEN WHICH I HAVE SET UP OUT IN MY DINING ROOM THE PLAYER IS SIMPLE TO USE AND WORKS WONDERFUL FOR MY PURPOSES I RECOMMEND THIS UNIT TO ANYONE WANTING AN INEXPENSIVE DVD PLAYER. YOU WON'T BE DISSAPOINTED.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: 2018 model; didn't need internet updating, after connecting with ethernet connection; recognized blurays w/o a problem (on the first try!); don't have a 4k tv or 3d capability to test these features. (Used for a month, so far.)
customer_reviews.author: purchaser in nj

customer_reviews.title: No bloat were just a player
customer_reviews.text: Works great no complaints, hooked a hard drive up to it watched some movies, have not found a blue ray or dvd that it can not play, got this bbn one because it t had no bloat wear which is super nice.
customer_reviews.author: brendan

customer_reviews.title: Bright white background on the menu screen is unpleasant in a dark room, otherwise would be a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the player works great. My only dissatisfaction is the menu screen. It has a bright white background which is unpleasant in a dark room. My past players have had a subdued decorative blue background. Otherwise, I would have given a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Azul

customer_reviews.title: Choose a different player
customer_reviews.text: I have had a difficult time with this player from the start. It randomly turns off while playing a dvd. Quite often I have to turn it off and on multiple times before it connects to the tv.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Good investment
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 actually. I am using one and have been for about 8 months now. Loved it so much, I bought another when and if the first one gives out. Easy to hook up and easy to use. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence J. Ukolowicz

customer_reviews.title: This LG player was perfect for my situation and so was the price
customer_reviews.text: I have a Roku device, so I just wanted a Blu-Ray and DVD with 4K capability. All the other premium brand 4K units had streaming services and packages that I didn't need or want. This LG player was perfect for my situation and so was the price. I have no complaints and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Can't really tell the difference.
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaces an ancient DVD/VCR. I also have a Phillips BluRay I bought in 2010 and i compared BluRay and DVD disks between the two players and was not able to tell any difference on a 4K TV. Not really sure what I was paying for. I don't have any 3D disks so maybe those would show something.
customer_reviews.author: W. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hook up; easy to use; small and lightweight to carry to other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Can't turn off automatic upscaling.
customer_reviews.text: It's good for the price. Wish there was a way to turn off the upscaling on non-4k disks since our new tv is better at that. You can manually switch it to output 1080p our lower but it's inconvenient to have to do that.
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Harold

customer_reviews.title: He loves it
customer_reviews.text: I got it as a gift for my husband. He loves it so much he hid the remote from me, because I have a tendency to lose remotes he said. Of course, that doesn't explain why I'm not allowed to use it.
customer_reviews.author: recheal71

customer_reviews.title: Decent but save up for a better 4k player
customer_reviews.text: Decent, but lacks wifi card, and locks up occasionally, and quality is ok. Save up for a better one. Also if you want 4k plus 7.1 with a reciever that doesnt have 4k pass-through, save up and buy a 4k player with Hdmi audio out and hdmi video/audio out. Fiber optic cable only allows up to 5.1.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Good features
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this player to replace a Panasonic which had started to pause/stop during playback of DVD/USB media. Easy set up and quick reading, playing of Discs, CD/DVD, was pretty quick. There was an option to connect to the internet via cat 5 cable but I do not need this function. It does what I need it to, Play. The media guide layout when watching media from the USB port is not quite intuitive, it is laid out top to bottom, left to right like reverse Japanese which is top to bottom right to left. Otherwise I'll be looking to purchase another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Butko

customer_reviews.title: Good, one thing lacking
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried any Ulta 4K blu-rays in the device so I can't evaluate it. One thing I found lacking however is a CC button on the remote. I'm a little hard of hearing and almost always use captions, using a button was easier than going to disc set up all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Carter

customer_reviews.title: Nice player, case size fits my rack nicely
customer_reviews.text: Nice player, case size fits my rack nicely. Wish it had a front time/counter display, but otherwise, great picture and sound, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bob P.

customer_reviews.title: Give it a shot
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why it won’t keep my current settings but otherwise, it works as described.
customer_reviews.author: Jose P.

customer_reviews.title: a great picture (both native 4K and Blu-Ray upscaled) and great ...
customer_reviews.text: It's everything I needed in a 4K UHD Blu-Ray player--basically, a great picture (both native 4K and Blu-Ray upscaled) and great sound. If you need a smart Blu-Ray player this isn't it--but everything in my entertainment setup (5 game consoles and the TV itself) stream content, so all I wanted was a great player. This is that.
customer_reviews.author: David Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for someone that only needs a DVD player for specific uses.
